revised_title: An Unusual Case of Bladder Stones: A Medical Report
tldr: A medical report from 1673 describes the case of a 71-year-old man who passed away after suffering from severe pain and urinary issues. Upon autopsy, 38 stones were found in his bladder, with the largest being the size of a pigeon egg. The report discusses the stones' appearance, weight, and the lack of stones in the kidneys and ureters, leaving room for further discussion on their formation and potential treatment options.
